The collaboration with Wallen, a major star within the genre, further legitimizes the entry and likely attracts votes. My probability is not higher because as a newcomer, Post Malone faces stiff competition from established country royalty who have dedicated their careers to the genre. There's always a possibility that voters will lean towards rewarding 'one of their own,' especially if the vote is split across several strong contenders. My probability is not lower because ignoring a song with the cultural and commercial impact of 'I Had Some Help' would be a significant oversight by the Academy. Earning four nominations indicates he is not being dismissed as a novelty. I would raise my forecast if key industry publications and insiders began predicting a win for him, signaling a consensus is forming. I would lower it if a different artist or song began to build overwhelming momentum and sweep precursor events, or if there was any negative sentiment from the Nashville community regarding his crossover.
